Package net.proteusframework.cms.controller.ckeditor Description

Connector API. This API allows customization of the integration between the CKEditor and CMS.

Common Use Cases:

  • Alias directories or file names.
  • Additional control over files / folders that are visible.
  • Change the filesystem root(s) available.
  • Modify the CMS pages that are available for selection.
  • Implement CKEditor configuration javascript using server-side code.

Typical use in an MIWT program:

   Field field = new Field();
   field.setRichEditor(true);
   ConnectorRegistration registration = CKEditorConnector.registerConnectorInSession('meaningful_name', MyCustomConnector.class);
   field.setRichEditorConfig(registration.createConfigURL(Event.response).getURL(true));
   add(field);

Example connector:

 class MyCustomConnector extends ConnectorImpl
 {
   public PageListResult getPageList(ConnectorContext ctx)
   {
     final PageElementPathDAO rpm = PageElementPathDAO.getInstance();
     final List paths = rpm.getPageElementPathsDisassembledForFolder('microsite_a',
       ctx.getSite(), true);
     final PageListResultImpl plr = new PageListResultImpl(0, "Success", paths);
     plr.addPageInfo(new PageInfoImpl(ctx.getSite().getDefaultHostname().getWelcomePage().getPrimaryPageElementPath()));
     return plr;
   }
 }
